intro: Cyclodium trianae var. chocoense, commonly known as the Chocoan cyclodium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, often yellow or greenish flowers. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its native habitat.
